judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ. '
Mr. Chief Justice Bell dissents and would reverse and reject appellees’ claim on the ground of laches of forty years.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree affirmed. Appellants to pay costs.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell dissents and would reverse and reject appellees’ claim on the ground of laches of forty years.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William H. Rivoir, Jr., with him Gawthrop & Greenwood, for appellants.
Richard W. Stevens, with him Clark, Ladner, Fortenbaugh & Toung, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Kates Estate.
Argued April 29, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ. '
William H. Rivoir, Jr., with him Gawthrop & Greenwood, for appellants.
Richard W. Stevens, with him Clark, Ladner, Fortenbaugh & Toung, for appellee.
October 9, 1970:
